title: PG ranges and `contains`
body:
## Problem

It's currently not possible to use PG ranges in a meaningful way, because helper methods such as `@>`, or `.contains` in diesel are not defined.

For example, I would like to be able to do something like the following:

```
table! {
    extra (id) {
        id -> Int4,
        client -> Int4,
        range -> Range<Date>,
    }

    client (id) {
        id -> Int4,
        name -> Text,
    }
}

client
        .left_join(
            extra.on(other_table::dsl::client
                .eq(client_table::dsl::id)
                .and(other_table::dsl::range.contains(diesel::dsl::date(diesel::dsl::now))))
        )
```

the compiler complains that `.contains` is not implemented, and only suggests `diesel::PgArrayExpressionMethods`, which implies that there is no trait which implements these methods for PG ranges.

Currently the columns are implemented as separate `start_date` and `end_date`, but there is a requirement for no overlapping ranges, which is trivial with a PG EXCLUDE + DATERANGE and not so trivial with separate columns.

I think this is something I could make a start at -- or at least get `.contains` working, but it would be nice to have some guidance / feedback that this is indeed a missing feature and is something that should be worked on.

## Checklist

- [x] I have already looked over the [issue tracker](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues) for similar issues.
